result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason M Barnard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Early release authorized if qualifies.  Payment plan to be set up with agent within 30 days.

miscConds.notes: Plus supervision fees.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.    $250 represents DNA surcharge.

No contact with:  David Kammeyer, except for employment.  Other contact with David Kammeyer to be with agent's consent.    Not to associate with anyone using or possessing illegal drugs. Not to possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance not prescribed by authorized medical personnel.    Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.    Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.    Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

timeConds.notes: Imposed and Stayed - to be activated by the agent.

records.addlTxt: Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order - ERP, to reflect conversion of confinement time to extended supervision due to completion of earned release program.
dated 08/26/2016 from DOC to BR II re conversion of confinement time to extended supervision due to completion of earned release program.
Atty Laurie Sazama Osberg appointed.
Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgment signed by defendant in court.

re Count 1 -  3 years Initial Incarceration and 2 years Extended Supervision - both imposed and stayed.  36 months Probation.  Conditions of Probation:  any counseling per the agent, 100 hrs Community Service, submit a DNA sample, No contact with: D.K., except for employment and any other contact with D.K. is with the agent's consent,   Not to possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance not prescribed by authorized medical personnel,  Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs,   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia,   Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol,   Not to associate with anyone using or possessing illegal drugs. Court costs = $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge, early release authorized if qualifies.  Establish a payment plan within 30 days with Probation agent.  60 days Jail imposed and stayed, to be activated by the Probation agent.  Early release authorized if qualifies.  Defendant qualifies for both Substance Abuse Program and Challenge Incarceration Program.

court minutes filed.   Defendant pleads to Count 1 (no repeater).  Factual basis found.  Court accepts plea as voluntarily and knowingly and intelligently made.   Court finds defendant Guilty of Count 1.  Counts 2, 3 and 4 dismissed and read-in.
